citation.article-title: A new filamentous, gliding bacterium, Filibacter limicola gen. nov. sp. nov., from lake sediment.

p.s: Filibacter (Fi.li.bac'ter, L. n. filum a thread; M.L. masc. n. bacter masculine form of Gr. neut. n. bactrum a rod; M.L. masc. n. Filibacter thread rod.)
Filaments composed of cylindrical cells, straight or curved.
Cell junctions clearly marked by constriction.
Filaments are flexible, but do not show active flexing, are not sheathed and do not branch.
Motile by gliding, giving characteristic spreading growth and spiral colonies on solid media.
Intracellular sulphur granules not formed in the presence of hydrogen sulphide.
Oxidase positive, major cytochrome component c-type.
Major quinone isoprenolog is menaquinone (MK-7 in type strain).
The G + C content of the type strain is 44 mol % (Tm).
Type species: Filibacter limicola gen. et sp. nov.
